verses.roman:
āha cāham ihāyāta
ārya-miśrābhisaṅgataḥ
rājanyāś caidya-pakṣīyā
nūnaṁ hanyuḥ purīṁ mama

synonyms: āha—He said; ca—and; aham—I; iha—to this place (Indraprastha); āyātaḥ—having come; miśra—the distinguished personality; abhisaṅgataḥ—accompanied; rājanyāḥ—kings; caidya-pakṣīyāḥ—siding with Caidya (Śiśupāla); nūnam—certainly; hanyuḥ—must be attacking; purīm—city; mama—My.
translation: The Lord said to Himself: Because I have come here with My respected elder brother, kings partial to Śiśupāla may well be attacking My capital city.
